message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: int lineCount = 0;
String line;
while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
    lineCount++;
    if (lineCount == totalLines) {
        break;
    }
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line);
    graph.addEdge(Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken()), Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken()));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can keep track of the line count using a variable and break out of the loop when the line count reaches the total number of lines you want to process. In this example, the variable "lineCount" is incremented for each line read, and when it reaches the "totalLines" value, the loop is exited using the "break" statement. This way, the last line is not processed by the StringTokenizer.
